entries.meaning: The act of flowing or proceeding (of something, quality, or feeling) from a source or origin.
That which issues, flows, or proceeds from any object as a source; efflux; an effluence.
examples: Perfume is an emanation from a flower.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, obsolete, physics, chemistry) The element radon (Rn)
examples: Hyponyms: radium emanation, thorium emanation, actinium emanation

entries.meaning: (theology) The generation of the Son and the procession of the Holy Spirit, as distinct from the origination of created beings.
